title: Do male teachers find their female students attractive? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure. Now, let me be more clear, because that answer is going to be grossly misleading without proper context. I can look at someone, male or female, and appreciate their aesthetic. People are allowed to be attractive, there’s no crime in it. Some of my students are objectively attractive. But, you know what else they are? They are kids, under my care. It doesn’t matter how pretty they may be, they are young and need adults to treat them like people. They need people to exemplify what SHOULD be demonstrated every day, that your looks and gender don’t influence your worth or potential. That you have more to offer someone than your sexuality. For that reason alone, nothing, and I mean NOTHING, would convince me to act. Furthermore, attraction is a lot more than aesthetic. Have you ever met a pretty person with a terrible personality? I have. It’s the same way with my students. Not a single one has a personality I find attractive, because, once again, they are kids. We have nothing in common, we have nothing that we relate to each other with on a personal level, there is no way that a romantic emotional attachment would form between us. I don’t care if they are 18, they are still 10 years younger than I am. Not my cup of tea,

Some might, but whether it is normal or not is another matter on its own. If we are talking about high school teacher then it’s certainly disturbing that the male teacher would find his female students romantically/sexually attractive. This type of men are the last people to be allowed near any school let alone be a teacher. High school girls are developing kids, who are still in their physical and primary mental stages of development. They don’t look like grown women yet, and if a man can differentiate his feelings toward young girls vs young women, then he might have some problem. Now, if we are talking about college teacher or professor then that’s a different matter. College kids are young men and women in their physical prime. Attraction toward them is normal but acting on it is not appropriate.

Male teachers are only human. And it’s normal for men of all ages to find young, attractive women attractive. So, I think it likely that some male teachers find some of their female students attractive. And the same for female teachers and male students. It’s biology. Being a teacher does not mean one loses his/her awareness towards attractive members of the opposite sex. But many people assume finding a student attractive equates to some perversion or some potential wrongdoing (which it can, but not automaticaly). Thoughts are not crimes. One can notice an attractive person and simply leave it at that. If we could be convicted because of impure or inappropriate thoughts, we’d all be locked up.

I believe everyone of us encountered a pervert teacher once in our lifetime. I am not trying to sound any wrong here,but we boys recognise a pervert teacher way early than a girl ever think of that man llike this or realise it. If you are curious about reason ,then I'll say, Because We are boys , we know how a boy or man touch or talk when he is showing affection/love,asking things or behaving like a teacher or when he is giving a perverted touch. And there's another reason,we don't trust people who is extremely sweet to girls,we always be cautious about them and watch their actions carefully. I can't say whether a girl is pervert or not😅.. When we were in Std.7 ,we had a Science teacher,S***j J*******l (yup,I remember his name).He was 24–25 years of age,a young teacher.When he came to our class for the first time,he was showing extra attention to girls. The first thing every boys in our class told about him was,” Tharki hai Sa**a ( He is a pervert”. After few days,his attention toward girls increased and he started having sweet talks and touching them.For that time,we were sure that he is a pervert and we always used to talk about him that how he is touching girls of our class.Maybe our assumptions were wrong….hold with me…. When I was in Std.10 . Our English tuition teacher's husband was a Biology teacher who used to take classes of 10+2 students,he was 50–60 years old. Sometimes during our tuition he used to come to talk to us (us never meant boys or all students). He used to pinch girl's cheeks,touch them in the wrong way, with disguisting smile and sweet talks. He used to do the same to our friend(girl), we(me and my friends,except her) always used to get angry or get disguisted just by his presence..believe me ,the first impression we have of him was of a pervert….. Maybe,here too our assumptions were wrong.. Getting back to the stories…We told about Science teacher to one of our classmate,she didn't believe us and left saying you all are assuming things. When we told about that that old man to our friend,she didn't believe us. Cinclusion:-1st story:After one month many seniors(girls) complained about that Science teacher and he was fired.Reason,he was a pervert,always touch them in the wrong way……… 2nd story: When we were in class 11th ,and out of town (we all went to study in different cities) we heard a story of that old man being attacked(attacked in the sense,being shot by the gun but bullet missed the old man) by a girl's father.Reason,he used touch that girl (all girls) in a wrong way and tease her.She complained about that old man to his father .And his father attecked that old man in rage……..So,our assumptions were never wrong😅 …………………. :)

I started substitute teaching (while I was working on my master’s of education) at 23 just after I finished my undergrad. For most of the students that I was working with I was within 5–7 years (in rare cases I was almost ten). For reference my parents are six years apart which is about average in my family, so growing up I always considered this kind of an age gap normal. When I started working in high schools; however, that changed. There was something so young about the students that was just a major turn off. Now granted going in I had a mentor tell me: “remember Ryan; Lolita was a warning, not a romance.” Now of course I never had any intention of throwing my career away over having any kind of inappropriate relationship. Though, thinking of Lolita as a warning I figured there would me more temptation. For me there has never been any kind of attraction. I will say that because I am human that I find myself evaluating the aesthetic attractiveness of students without even realizing it. Honestly though, when I do it’s far less exciting than seeing a cute dog.

Can’t say anything about male teachers being attracted to female student, but I think I have seen the opposite happen more often. There have been so many news about female teachers seducing and doing things with teenage boys. I don’t think I have to put the links for news articles. You get the point. Even when I was a teenager, and was in grade 8, there was one teacher who one day, told me that she likes me and just looked at me in an innocent but weird way. It was very odd because we were not even close, I was shy kid, not good at studies, and never talked to teachers, and when she suddenly told that to me, it was very uncomfortable and foreign, I didn’t know how to react. But nothing else happened more than that. It was veeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeerrry weird.

Answers like Gabriel disturb me, I get the feeling he’s a repressed pervert/pedophile himself. Yes, I acknowledge their cuteness and/or beauty. I have students from elementary all the way up to 39. I’m 45. Many college girls are beautiful and we compliment each other all the time for the sake of English- manners (compliments) are nice. Many students have said they want a boyfriend like me, to marry a guy like me. They are attracted to me. Looks, I speak and know both cultures, tough guy, smart, balanced, unique, funny…there are many reasons for attraction. I am attracted to a few of my female students that are older, they are really beautiful and smart. I’m even attracted to some mothers who give me gifts and praise. I don’t know how some of you define attraction, but mine isn’t about sexual fantasy. This is Crystal who is a student of mine. I find her attractive, he husband is also a student and he’s a stud. We’re all close friends and we’re building homes next to each other.

Austin Schopper had a really good answer. For me, I think of it as a part of my brain that is switched off when dealing with students. Yeah, it’s impossible to miss that they’re in the bloom of youth. I’ve had female students who were literally models. But … they’re kids, and they’re MY students. Their trust in me matters a great deal, far more than anything I would ever get out of anything physical with them. And as Schopper said, they are kids. It’s impossible to be attracted (unless you’re a lothario) to someone below yourself intellectually.

Yes they do. In STEM fields there is a lot of sexual coercion and sexual predators. There is a high chance that if a professor makes you understand he has an eye for you, he will come take what he wants from you and he wont care about your consent. Its often a power trip aimed at humiliating you and boosting their ego rather than any real interest about who you are as a person. There is a lot of competition nowadays between professors about how many first year students they can fuck in a semester. They rarely see their students as people and couldnt care less about ethics since they are never prosecuted for sexual abuse.

If they answer this question yes they should quit being teachers. Grown men attracted to children are just weird. I know it’s a big wide world and “to each their own” but there is a special word for grown men who are attracted to children and generally that world ends up with the men being arrested, tried and put behind bars and if they are lucky not having the shit beaten out of them while they are there. Male teachers — or paedophiles — who find their female students attractive should quit before they get sacked.

YES. I was one of those students in high school that caught the eye of the Head Coach of the athletics department. He was married but seemed to have no problem pursuing a 16 yr old for some passion play. Luckily things didn't go too far, and I was the one who put a stop to it, but he moved on to another girl. It was strange to know that secret about him but I chalked it up to a learning experience about men. There are good ones and bad ones.

The young males and females just out of college often do. Older teachers not so much but sometimes. this is the reason why if I’m a high school principal I won’t hire those who are fresh from college. they’d need to be at least 30 or so. At that age I won’t worry about an attraction to students. That’s especially true for boys as they’re horn dogs. a really attractive woman just out of college is also a liability at the high school level . All the fellas would hit on her.

Some do, of course, we teachers are only human but….we don't ever do anything about it. When I was in my 30s an 18 year-old young man thought he had fallen in love with me. It was very difficult. I had to be very careful how I dealt with it. A fellow teacher helped me talk to him.

Sometimes. And so, sometimes, do the female teachers; and some teachers find some of their male students attractive too. But it shouldn’t matter too much if a teacher merely ‘find you attractive’ - some people are naturally attractive, and if that’s you then good for you - but teachers should suppress any feelings they have for pupils.

It is normal for some males to be attracted to some females, yes. It doesn't mean they should quit their job like some other ignorant answer suggested and then disabled comments (gotta love those Quorans 🙄). As long as they don't cross boundaries, they're not doing anything wrong.

I will be honest and say I don’t but my wife is the only female I have found to be truly beautiful in the past few decades. Me, width my broken nose and scars I know have a face only a mother could love. Hence only one women is beautiful to me.

More than likely.I mean they are men and men are human beings.But here is where the head should overrule the heart.Getting involved with a female student isn’t worth the heat and aggravation,so backing off is recommended and advise.You can look and admire,but don’t cross that line.

In the 70s when I was in college, male college professors considered bedding the “liberated” coeds one of the perks of the job. Things are different now. How different, I wouldn’t know. (Come to think of it, “coed” is a pretty sexist concept.) (Come to think of it, many of those coeds probably got really good recommendations from the professors who bedded them.)

Of course they do. At least in some cases. Just the way some females find some males attractive. That doesn’t make either party a pervert. It makes them human. Acting on it constitutes criminal behavior. That is entirely different but it wasn’t your question.

There would be something wrong with them if they didnt. I work in a women’s college teaching a class of 18–19 year olds. Jailbait. The only difference is whether or not the said teacher acts on his impulses and keeps his pecker zipped up inside his trousers. Hitting on students is a jailing offence and most teachers find no one student is worth losing your job or freedom over. Thats been my experience anyway.

You must be a pedophile. Even If It’s just “finding them attractive at first” It can lead to something bigger later on. Desires like these lead people to become obsessed over time. Don’t be a disgusting old piece of shit. They’re your students, treat them as such. Just because you like one of your students that doesn’t mean they like you back. Stop lurking In the shadows and get some professional help.
I’ve seen a lot of opposite my dad when he taught when he was twenty five he said almost all the girls in his class since they were like 12 th grade they had a crush on him
not everyone but yes. Any one in any position can find the opposite sex attractive if they are good looking. Attraction levels may vary

I'm studying now in class 7 .my Kanada sir is very strict. He is my favorite teacher. He very graduated that if any teachers be absent he takes class even maths he can at least 80%. He beats very hardly to boys even who studies well. But he is not bad after he takes care and do jokes. He beats girls also but he gives excuse he excuses to boys also. He did not beat one time also me he scolded only one because I was laughing at class 6 . At two years I got one time scolding . My favorite teacher
